Package net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math

Class PiecewiseConstantTimeWindow

java.lang.Object
net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math.AbstractPiecewiseConstant
net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math.PiecewiseConstantTimeWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
PiecewiseConstant
public final class PiecewiseConstantTimeWindow extends AbstractPiecewiseConstant
Immutable implementation of PiecewiseConstant that models a time window where work is enabled (value = 1) only within a specific period, and disabled (value = 0) before and after that period.

This represents a function that:

  • Returns Fraction.ZERO for all times before offBefore
  • Returns Fraction.ONE for all times between offBefore and offAfter
  • Returns Fraction.ZERO for all times after offAfter

This is useful for modeling tasks or resources that are only available during a specific time window.

  • Constructor Details

    • PiecewiseConstantTimeWindow

      public PiecewiseConstantTimeWindow(LocalDateTime offBefore, LocalDateTime offAfter)
      Constructs a PiecewiseConstantOffBeforeOffAfter with the given time window.
      Parameters:
      offBefore - The time point before which work is disabled.
      offAfter - The time point after which work is disabled.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if offAfter is not after offBefore

  • Method Details

    • segmentAt

      public Segment segmentAt(LocalDateTime instant, TimeDirection direction)
      Returns the segment containing the given instant.

      This method implements the core logic of the piecewise constant function by determining which of the three regions (before, during, or after the active window) contains the given instant, and returns an appropriate segment.

      Parameters:
      instant - The instant for which to find the containing segment.
      direction - The direction of iteration (FORWARD or BACKWARD).
      Returns:
      A segment containing the instant with the appropriate value (0 or 1).
